name: CC0394 - ITP-009 - Fire Service Installation & Commissioning
template name: CC0394 - ITP-009 - Fire Service Installation & Commissioning REV1

name: Lot Status
values: Awaiting Hold Point Release, Awaiting NCR Closure, Awaiting Test Results, Awaiting Verification, Cancelled, Closed-out, Outstanding, Work In Progress

name: Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Prior to excavations being carried out, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out all fire lines including hydrants and risers.
Acceptance criteria - All materials selected in accordance with AS4130 and RJE civil specification and drawings.
Ref docs - IFC Drawings AS3500, Excavation permit
Acceptance criteria - All excavations subject to inspection prior to the installation of services and throughout the duration of the excavation.
○ Excavate to the lines, levels and grades as required for in ground services specified in accordance with the requirements of AS 3500.
Ref docs - IFC Drawings and specifications
Acceptance criteria - Remove obstructions including roots, stumps, boulders, and the like which may, in the opinion of Symal, interfere with the proper functioning of the service.
Ref docs - IFC Drawings and specifications
Acceptance criteria - Pipes should be bedded and supported by class 3 quarry material with a minimum thickness of 75mm.
○ 5-10mm crushed rock or sand shall be used as the haunching material.
Ref docs - IFC Drawings and specifications
Acceptance criteria - Work shall be carried out by and under the direct supervision of appropriately licenced personnel.
○ During construction, temporarily seal open ends of pipes and valves to prevent the entry of foreign matter into pipe systems.
○ Install piping in straight lines at uniform grades without sags.
Ref docs - as per manufacturers recommendations
Acceptance criteria - Ensure pipe is cleaned and scraped prior to welding.
○ Ensure pipe is fixed firmly in position.
○ Allow curing time as per specific fittings recommendations, Visually check all fittings have been welded.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Electrofusion welder calibration certificate.
Ref docs - IFC Drawings and specifications AS3500.1
Acceptance criteria - Minimum depth of cover for buried pipes: 600mm to finished surface.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - IFC Drawings and specifications AS3500
Acceptance criteria - After pipes & fittings have been set in the correct position and jointed, further bedding material shall be used to fill all recesses below sockets, and bottoms of trenches.
○ Trench backfilled with selected clean excavated material, or the purchased material bought to site.
○ BACKFILL Overlay WITH 20mm nominal size class 3 crushed rock
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Backfill material must be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 300mm.
○ Backfill trenches as soon as possible after approval of laid and bedded service.
Acceptance criteria - Compaction to be undertaken using hand methods only for first 300mm.
Ref docs - IFC Drawings RJE NOE AS3500.1
○ Complete Hydrostatic test for 2 Hours @ 1700kpa. Pressure deviation to be not more than +/- 35Kpa.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Prior to the commencement of works, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out the works and clearly mark its limits.
Acceptance criteria - Materials used for the installation of Hydrants to be in accordance with AS3500
Acceptance criteria - Ensure fire hydrants are located such that they do not impact vehicle access.
○ Bollards are to be installed for physical protection.
Acceptance criteria - On completion, each line shall be free from dirt, debris, or other impediments.
Acceptance criteria - All pipe and hydrants to be pressure tested in accordance with AS3500.1
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Accurately record the routes of all underground pipes before backfilling.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
